questions.question: Which fixative is most suitable for preserving cytologic specimens obtained from fine needle aspiration (FNA)?
questions.explanation: 95% ethanol is commonly used to preserve cellular detail in cytology specimens like FNA samples.

questions.question: What is the most appropriate embedding medium for routine histopathologic tissue sections?
questions.explanation: Paraffin wax is the standard embedding medium used for most routine histopathologic tissue sections.

questions.question: Which staining technique is most useful for detecting fungal organisms in tissue sections?
questions.explanation: Grocott's methenamine silver stain is excellent for visualizing fungi in tissue sections.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes autolysis?
options: Active enzymatic digestion of cells after death
questions.answer: Active enzymatic digestion of cells after death
questions.explanation: Autolysis refers to self-digestion or breakdown of cells by their own enzymes after death.

questions.question: Which type of cytology preparation is used for cervical cancer screening?
questions.explanation: The Papanicolaou (Pap) smear is the primary cytologic test for cervical cancer screening.

questions.question: Which Philippine law governs the practice of medical technology?
questions.explanation: Republic Act No. 5527, also known as the Philippine Medical Technology Act of 1969, governs the practice of medical technology in the Philippines.

questions.question: What is the purpose of decalcification in histopathology?
options: To soften hard tissues for sectioning
questions.answer: To soften hard tissues for sectioning
questions.explanation: Decalcification is performed to soften bone and calcified tissues so they can be cut into thin sections.

questions.question: In the MedTech Code of Ethics, which value is emphasized when refusing to issue falsified laboratory results?
questions.explanation: Upholding honesty is crucial to maintain integrity and public trust in laboratory services.

questions.question: Which act regulates clinical laboratories in the Philippines to ensure proper standards?
questions.explanation: Republic Act No. 4688 governs the regulation and licensure of clinical laboratories in the Philippines.

questions.question: What is the main reason for logging and proper labeling of specimens in the histopathology laboratory?
options: To prevent specimen mix-up and ensure accurate diagnosis
To comply with waste disposal laws
questions.answer: To prevent specimen mix-up and ensure accurate diagnosis
questions.explanation: Accurate logging and labeling prevent errors, ensure patient safety, and support reliable diagnoses.
